attribution: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (public domain)

image_description: A bat hangs from the branches of a tree. It is facing the camera with its wings partially extended, allowing the sunlight to cast through on one side. It has prominent elbows and a highly furred body, mostly grey but with a red ruff collar. It has small pointed ears raised upward, large front-facing brown eyes, and a long snout with split nostrils on its grey head.

A group of around 20 grey bats hanging from a stone ceiling. The wings are a darker grey or black, while the fur is a light grey. Mostly only their heads are visible. Some of their eyes reflect the flash light.

A thin bat hangs from a slender branch, looking towards the camera. It has light brown fur with darker fur on its wings. Its ears are rounded and ribbed, and it has large black eyes and a thin snout that resembles a mouse.

A bat hangs from some thin, reedy branches in the daylight, facing the camera. It has light reddish-brown fur and a black face, adjoined by small, black ears curving to a sharp point. Its large eyes are dark reddish-brown. It is covering its body partially with a black, soft-looking wing, its feet and free wing clinging to the branch.

attribution: Cardoso Cláudio V, et al. (CC BY)

image_description: A bat hangs from a mossy branch in a night scene. It has greyish-brown fur and a thick torso. Its ears are triangular and close to its head, facing outwards. It has almond-shaped brown eyes with a black pupil. Its nose is distinctly leaf-shaped and extends above the line of its head.

Close-up of a velvety brown bat lying in a prone position. It has small pointed ears and very large brown eyes. Its snout is short and thick with pointed split nostrils and a strong jaw full of thick but slightly blunted teeth. It has prominent whiskers and chin hairs.
A fruit bat fills the main part of the screen. Its body is mostly a furry brown, with the wings outstretched and translucent. In the background is some mountainous green landscape.

A brown bat hanging in an inverted position. It has small ears which are edged with patches of white/pale skin. Its wings are also spotted with pale patches. It has light brown eyes, a shortened muzzle and elongated, tubular nostrils.

attribution: Paul Asman and Jill Lenoble (CC BY)

image_description: Three bats of the same species hanging from a cluster of branches. They each have grey bodies with a ruff of reddish-brown fur around their collars, each with varying shades of grey head fur. They have long snouts ending in split nostrils and black eyes. The frontmost bat is nestled into its mother and is facing away from the camera. The mother is looking at the camera, her black wings partially outstretched. A third bat hangs close behind her, also looking towards the camera.

attribution: Paul Asman and Jill Lenoble (CC BY)
U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (public domain)

image_description: A young brown bat with only its face visible as it is being held in a white cotton glove. It has coarse brown fur and wide brown ears that lay flat against its head. Its black eyes are very large, and beneath the eye, there is a fold of skin joining the ear to the jaw. Its nose is flat, with ridges extending around to join the previous skin line. Its lips are thick, with a prominent jutting lower lip.

attribution: Sarah H. Olson, et al. (public domain)

common_name: East African little collared fruit bat

attribution: Sébastien J. Puechmaille, et al. (CC BY)

image_description: A small, approximately palm-sized bat, being held between pinched fingers. It has a head almost the same size as its body, with a leaf-shaped nose and short, ridged, wide ears. Its eyes are black and very small. Its fur is mostly light brown and is slightly darker around the head. Its legs lack fur and it has clawed feet.

A brown bat hangs from a rock surface. It has a long and thick body, and its wings are folded in against its body. It has short but wide ridged ears that fold over slightly at the tips and very small brown eyes. Its large nose is leaf-shaped, with some visible ridges where it meets the upper lip.
A plump little bat with a pale belly and dark, velvety wings, hanging by its feet from a cave wall.

attribution: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (CC BY)

image_description: A bat hanging from a vertical surface. Its dark fur has two golden ripples going parallel down its back. Its little grippy toes are spread out, wings are folded next to it, and its face is pushed up like its doing cobra pose. Its curved mouth looks like it's smiling at the viewer.

Two bats hang from a wall. They are both facing out but slightly away from the camera in a mirrored pose. They have thick, small brown bodies with a light brown curving streak down their backs. Their wings appear to be short. They have small, ridged, pointed ears, medium-sized black eyes, and prominently upturned noses ending in points. The underside fur is markedly lighter than the topside.

A grey bat hangs upside down from a piece of wood by one foot. It has mottled brown wings which are folded back and is raising its head to look towards the camera. It has long and slim ears that point upward, black eyes, and a tall, oval-shaped leaf-nose with a ridge running down the middle.

Over a dozen small pale bats, packed in the spaces between some leaves on a plant. The bats are straw coloured, with pink faces and wing-tips, and the effect of multiple bats packed together is a bit like seeing a bat-coloured hydrangea blossom.

attribution: Northern Vosges Regional Nature Park (public domain)
Cardoso Cláudio V, et al. (CC BY)

image_description: A piebald bat with distinct black and white fur patches. On its head are two patches, one behind each ear, and a further patch over the nose. The neck has a band of white fur ruff, but otherwise, it is black. It is unclear if the bat has its eyes open or closed, as its pupils are black and the fur is dark. It has a broad, furless nose with prominent open nostrils and thin closed lips. Its ears are side-facing, slightly pointed, and smooth, with a small curved inner ear flap visible.

attribution: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (public domain)
U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (public domain)

image_description: A small brown bat is lying on a rock, facing towards the side of the camera with a shocked or surprised expression. Its wings are black but have distinct pink coloration on the arm and fingers. Its fur is very light brown, almost blending into the light-colored rock behind, and its ears are thin, rounded, and upward-facing with some small ridge lines inside them. It has small black eyes and a short snout with thick whiskers, distinct nostrils, and a small number of sharp teeth along the sides of the jaw but not at the front of the mouth.

attribution: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (CC BY)

image_description: A very small bat with brown fur resting on the palm of a hand, nomming on a grub.

attribution: Victoria Department of Environment & Primary Industries (CC BY-NC)
U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (CC BY)

image_description: A small and very round-looking bat is being held in a gloved hand. It has thick brown fur all over and large, pointed ears. Its eyes are small and black, with a short nose. It looks like it's a little disappointed in you.
A handsome tan bat with a long canine snout and wide brown eyes, hanging upside down from a leafy tree branch in the sun.

attribution: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (public domain)
U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (public domain)

image_description: A plump bat with glossy chocolate-brown fur, wings folded, clinging to a wall with its back feet.

attribution: Cardoso Cláudio V, et al. (CC BY)

image_description: A small brown bat with a large head is being held by its wings. Its mouth is open, showing a tongue and several very sharp teeth, with the canines being enlarged and prominent. Its eyes are closed. It has a short, forward-facing nose and pointed, slightly rearward-facing ears. It has short legs that are curled upward and a short tail extending from a flap of buttock skin.

attribution: Cardoso Cláudio V, et al. (CC BY)

image_description: A grey bat lies upon a piece of damp wood, facing the camera. Its exposed skin is thick and leathery. It has sparse fur and thick legs. Its head is very broad, with flattened ears facing downward and a wide, bulldog-like snout with prominent whiskers. We can just about see its exposed eyes under the shadow of its ears.

A brown, furry bat being held by its wings. It is approximately the size of a small mouse. It has a thick snout and a small nose with protruding nostrils. Its ears are rounded and slightly forward facing. Its eyes are round and completely black. It has thick but hairless legs with short claws.

attribution: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (public domain)
U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (public domain)
U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (public domain)
image_description: A small bat is being held in a white glove while someone holds a ruler against its wing. It has a dark brown face and ears, and rusty brown fur. Its eyes are small and black. Its mouth is open, showing a row of sharp teeth.

attribution: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (public domain)
U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (public domain)
U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (public domain)
common_name: Mixed colony of Indiana bats (Myotis sodalis) and little brown bats (Myotis lucifugus)

attribution: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (public domain)
U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (public domain)
U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (public domain)
image_description: The back of a pale bat, slightly blurry, soaring over a mottled surface. On closer examination, the mottled surface proves to be thousands of tightly packed bats, hanging upside-down from a cave roof, their pink noses and wing-tips against their brown fur.

attribution: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (public domain)

image_description: A small furred bat with rounded ears and a pert, upturned snout. The fur is mottled light and dark shades of brown with a distinct ruffle around the neck.

attribution: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (public domain)
U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (CC BY)
image_description: A furry reddish-brown bat is being held in a glove and looking at the camera, appearing surprised. Its ears are disproportionately large compared to its head, extending far above it, with prominent ridges and sharp peaks. Its face is very small in comparison to its ears. It has very small black eyes and a nose that rises directly between them. Its small mouth is open, exposing sharp but tiny teeth. Its wing membrane is leathery and a darker brown than its body.

attribution: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (CC BY)

image_description: A bat in flight against a black background is well lit. Its wings are curving in the air and are semi-translucent. Its body, about the size of a small mouse, is black all over, and it has a skin flap at the posterior with an integrated tail. Its feet are directly attached to the wing flap, resulting in its legs adjoining the skin flap and wings. It has rounded, forward-facing ears and centrally aligned black eyes. Its mouth is open, revealing two sharp canines and a short tongue.

A small brown bat being held with its wings fully extended. The bat's head faces towards the ground. Its fur and wings are a very light brown. It has a rounded belly, and we can see that the bat is male. It has short, rounded ears and a triangular-shaped head with a long snout and brown eyes.

A small bat in flight. Its wings are fully extended, showing a span (per wing) of maybe four to five times the body width. It has a grey body around the size of a large mouse and a reddish head with thin, pointed ears and small black eyes. Its teeth are barely visible through ridged lips and are sharp.

A bat in flight, wings fully extended and facing slightly away from the camera. The body is compact and brown-furred with a rounded head and short, pointed ears. Its mouth is open, showing a v-shaped jaw as though screaming, revealing rows of small teeth and two prominent upper canines.
A small brown bat shown in the typical head down vertical position. The bat has ridged ears and large expressive eyes.
A pale, furry, silvery-winged little bat in flight against a solid black background.

A small bat is being held between two fingertips, with its head and wings facing forward. It has light brown fur that becomes darker towards the back and head, ending with a tuft of brown fur on its head. It has small, pointy, round-tipped ears; its eyes are barely visible. Its mouth is open, showing four pointed teeth and a small tongue, with a slightly protruding lower lip.

A flipped image of a bat hanging upside down. The bat has its black wings wrapped around its body, exposing only its head. It has dark grey fur with a reddish 'mane' on the back and sides of its head. It has a dog-like muzzle, small rounded ears, and large black eyes that appear to be looking at the viewer.

A flying fox is hanging off a bare tree branch in daylight. The fox is holding onto the branch with both feet, and the claws of his wings, leaving his wings half spread. The bat has a friendly face, a red chest, and it is very evident he is male.

A bat against a black background. Its wings are outspread in flight, and below it is its reflection in water. The bat's body is golden, and its face, ears, and wings are dark. Water is dripping from its mouth, showing that it has just dipped into the water for a drink.

attribution: S. E. Santana, et al. (CC BY)

image_description: A tiny bat, about the size and colour of a mouse. It's being grasped delicately by a gloved thumb and forefinger.

attribution: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (public domain)
image_description: A crevice in a pale, rocky surface is tightly packed with over dozen bats. The impression is of a surface of velvety brown fur interrupted with pink noses and wing-tips. The bats have paler fur on their chests.

attribution: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (public domain)

common_name: Either a Wahlberg's epauletted fruit bat (Epomophorus wahlbergi) or a Peters's epauletted fruit bat (Epomophorus crypturus)
Either a Wahlberg's epauletted fruit bat (Epomophorus wahlbergi) or a Peters's epauletted fruit bat (Epomophorus crypturus)

image_description: A leaf-nosed bat about the size of the hand of the researcher holding it is biting the finger of the glove on the opposite hand. Because of the open mouth and small eye, the effect is of a very wide grin.
A close up of black mastiff bat's head in profile. It has red fur and a somewhat snub nose. It looks smug as hell for no reason.

A dark brown bat laying on a rocky surface, one wing extended on the far side. It has upward-pointed and ridged ears with rounded tips, and a small face with black eyes with a short snout, and a protruding bottom lip.
A bat with orange-coloured fur and a grey-furred, fox-like face flying low over water with its legs touching the surface. Droplets are flying behind.

attribution: Juan A. Malo de Molina (CC BY-SA)
Hernani F. M. de Oliveira (CC BY)

image_description: A small bat being held sideways between two fingertips. It has thick, reddish-brown fur and black wings, ears, eyes and nose. It has pointed ears that become ridged towards the tips and a tall leaf nose.

attribution: Prof. Dr. Marco A. R. Mello (CC BY)

image_description: A bat held by a human handler with one think, membranous wing extended. The bat has a skin flap which joins the legs to the wing, with the feet being the only exposed area of the leg. Its body is approximately as large as a human hand with muscular shoulders and a lightly furred brown body. Its snout is large and wide, its ears long and thin, extending upward. Its eyes are closed, and its mouth open, showing several large, sharp teeth.

attribution: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (public domain)
image_description: A fluffy bat is looking towards the camera while being held by a gloved hand. It has light brown fur that becomes darker further from the body before ending with frosted white tips. It has a short snout and beady, black eyes. Its ears are large and rounded, but are mostly buried in its fur.

attribution: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (public domain)
image_description: A small bat is being held by a gloved hand. It has light brown fur with dark brown wings and feet, and a dark brown face. Its wings are large, dark brown, and pointy. It has very small black eyes. Its mouth is open, as if screaming, exposing a number of pointed teeth.

A small bat laying atop some plastic equipment and a bundled rope. It has a brownish body with darker brown wings and face. It has very large, pointed ears with subtle ribbing inside. It has tiny black eyes. It appears to be looking up, mouth slightly agape, as if surprised.

A bat mid-flight during the daytime. It has reddish fur with grey skin, a dog-like snout, and very large, expressive brown eyes. Small, pointed ears stick out perpendicular to its head. It's lower body and feet are wet and matted.

The top of an archway of an old stone building, behind which dozens of bats can be seen roosting. All of them have brown bodies and black wings, with a few having visible black eyes and stubby, rounded snouts.

A bat is hanging from the branch of a leafy bush, looking around expectantly. It has a mostly black body except for a reddish tuft of fur around its neck. It has a long snout, large brown eyes, and small, rounded ears.

Nine small bats are clinging onto the underside of a tree branch above a body of water. Each of them has piebald brown and white fur, camouflaging them perfectly against the branch. Those facing outwards have short, pointy snouts, small ears, and round, black eyes.

A bat hangs upside down on the wood-panelled wall. It has brown wings and brown fur with white tips that becomes lighter on the underside of the body. It has a squashed muzzle, like a mastiff dog, and round, leathery ears.

A small, round bat is hanging from a rocky ceiling. It has black wings and beige fur that is slightly darker on the back than on the front. It has large, ridged ears and small, beady eyes. Its nose is large, flat, and round, with a pointed top that bends away from its face.
A bat hangs from a tree branch, facing towards the camera. It has reddish-brown fur and black wings and face. Its ears are large and triangular. Its snout is short and squashed looking.

A very small bat is being softly held in a gloved hand. It has a dark brown face, ears, and wings, with a much more striking reddish-brown fur colour. It has quite a flat face, with large, ridged ears that have rounded tips. It has a quite contented facial expression.
